title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.21 Part 2 | 24-08-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Amongst great bowmen this child will be as good as Arjuna. He will be as irresistible as fire and as unsurpassable as the ocean.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse to be discussed, focusing on the comparison of the child to Arjuna, fire, and the ocean.

segments.key_quote: Maharaj Drupada, Drupada was actually a king of the province called Panchaladesha, and he had as his son and daughter Drishtadyumna and Draupadi.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that there are two Arjunas in history and then begins to tell the story of Drupada and Dronacharya's relationship.

segments.key_quote: When you grow up, don't worry. I will give you half of my kingdom because I am the only son of my father. So I will give you half of my kingdom. Don't worry. You don't have to suffer in poverty like your father.
segments.summary: The speaker continues the story of Drupada and Dronacharya, focusing on their friendship in Gurukul and Drupada's promise to share his kingdom.

segments.key_quote: Friendship is always between equals. So you are a poor and wretched poverty stricken person. How can you be my friend? What is my status and what is your status?
segments.summary: The speaker describes Dronacharya's visit to Drupada and the insult he receives due to his poverty.

segments.key_quote: Dronacharya was powerful enough to kill Drona himself. Dronacharya never hesitated to impart all the military secrets to this boy because he was a Kshatriya and he had come seeking training in the military arts.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how Dronacharya became the teacher of the Pandavas and Kauravas and used them to defeat and capture Drupada, taking half his kingdom as revenge.

segments.key_quote: So Drupada even though he was defeated by Arjuna, still Drupada recognized that Arjuna is the best match for his daughter Draupadi.
segments.summary: The speaker continues the story, explaining how Drupada recognized Arjuna as the best match for Draupadi, but was saddened by the false news of Arjuna's death.

segments.key_quote: When the Pandavas heard that the Kshatriya kings failed to pass the test set by Drupada then Arjuna in the guise of a poor brahmana he passed the test and Draupadi was garlanded sorry Draupadi garlanded Arjuna though she did not know he was Arjuna.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes the story by describing the Swayamvara ceremony where Arjuna, disguised as a brahmana, wins Draupadi's hand in marriage.
